intro: Ischnosiphon ornatus, commonly known as the ornate ischnosiphon, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and its flowers are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
